channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 27 May
item.description: For the fifth day in a row, there are no new cases of Covid-19, the Prime Minister says it will not be too long before trans-Tasman travel is able to resume, GPs push for balance between face-to-face and online consultations and Australia recorded its ...

item.title: Immigration 'lottery': Avatar crew allowed in, America's Cup crews out
item.description: If foreign film crews are allowed an exemption to border rules, so too should America's Cup teams, the National Party says.

item.title: Missing trampers Dion Reynolds and Jessica O'Connor found alive, police confirm
item.description: Missing trampers Dion Reynolds and Jessica O'Connor stayed put and waited for help after suffering minor injuries in a fall, police have confirmed.

item.title: 'Milestone' pay settlement reached for teacher aides
item.description: The Ministry of Education and NZEI Te Riu Roa have agreed to settle an historic pay equity claim for teacher aides.

item.title: English language-only sign at cafe taken down
item.description: A sign in an Auckland cafe asking staff members to speak only English has been removed after it sparked debate when posted on social media.

item.title: Christchurch couple back in court despite winning Southern Response battle
item.description: A long-running legal battle between a Christchurch couple and Southern Response looks set to drag on.

item.title: 'Won't be too long' before trans-Tasman travel starts - PM
item.description: A group of government and business representatives will deliver a blueprint on how a trans-Tasman bubble could work early next month.

item.title: Uni may move hall residents to accommodate international students
item.description: The University of Auckland is considering moving domestic students out of halls of residence to make way for returning international students that need to be quarantined.

item.title: Academics say winter flu 'outbreaks' looming
item.description: It's hoped New Zealand efforts to flatten the Covid-19 curve will translate into a milder flu season this winter.

item.title: Wellington council delays library decision to seek more advice
item.description: A highly experienced engineer says many in the industry cannot understand how cost estimates to repair Wellington's shuttered city library could be more than rebuilding it.

item.title: WINZ says wrongly denied benefits due to 'isolated practice issues'
item.description: Work and Income has told the Social Development Minister there were "isolated practice issues" after people were wrongly denied the benefit based on redundancy payments.

item.title: Jet-skis, cash, cannabis and illegal rifle seized in Chch
item.description: Christchurch police have seized property worth more than $2.5 million as part of an investigation into the supply of cannabis and money laundering.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19, nobody in hospital with the coronavirus
item.description: New Zealand does not have a single person in hospital with Covid-19, as the country marks five consecutive days without a new case.

item.title: Massey University science faculty cuts casual staff
item.description: Staff on casual contracts at Massey University's science faculties have had their jobs axed with immediate effect as the institution desperately tries to cut costs.

item.title: Woman dies after being hit by train in Wellington
item.description: A woman has died after she was hit a train at a level crossing in Tawa in Wellington.

item.title: Dunedin councillors back motion to limit rates increases
item.description: The Dunedin City Council has agreed to limit rates to an increase of 4.1 percent for the coming financial year.

item.title: Plan to reduce death rate of seabirds launched
item.description: The government has launched a new plan today aimed at preventing seabirds from harm or death due to commercial fishing.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: The Ministry of Health is working on what level 1 and a trans-Tasman bubble will look like. Follow the rest of the day's Covid-19 developments with RNZ's blog.
